Name: Cracking the AP Chemistry Exam, 2015 Edition (College Test Preparation)

ReviewList.Text: I teach AP chemistry.  There is a substantial difference from the 2014 version to the 2015 copy.  The practice tests are much closer to what students will actually see on the AP test.  2015 FRQ section has removed the net-ionic equation question #4 that used to be on the exam and is now in the style of 3 long, 4 short FRQs.  Multiple choice questions are also grouped.  Practice problems do a good job of integrating lab/data analysis, much like what they would see on the AP exam.  I highly recommend this test prep book over all others that I've seen.

This review book not only has been preparing me for the AP Exam, but it is also helping with the concept we are learning in my AP Chemistry class. Good information and excellent review questions and tests.

This is a great review book. Every concept on the AP test is explained and explained well, and the questions are excellent. It was definitely my key tool as I prepared for the AP Chemistry test this year. If you're comparing it to other review books, the REA Crash Course for Chemistry is much more concise, but unless you only need something to look over briefly the Princeton is completely superior, especially since it has a plethora of practice questions while the Crash Course book has nearly none.

This book prepared me very well for the exam and the practice tests were very similar to the questions on the test. There was 1 or 2 errors in the key, but no review book will be perfect as I have learned. The topics were exactly what was on the AP exam and I highly recommend this book.

I got this book a few days before my ap chem. final, and it saved my life. It goes over all major topics and helps you effectively study what you don't have a perfect understanding of. I would recommend this to anyone taking the ap chemistry test.
Thank you so much !!! I love this book and it came earlier than Friday so I am very happy for the fast shipping
Went through the whole book in my AP chemistry class. Good coverage but for too many typos than I expected including ones that rendered a problem incomprehensible.

Even though this book contains a lot of helpful information, it skips over several topics and contains more than a few blatant mistakes in content and in practice tests, not to mention countless spelling and grammar mistakes that a two-year old could have caught. If you have a decent knowledge in chemistry or have taken the AP Chemistry class in the past, you can probably figure out the mistakes, as they are quite obvious, but if you're new to chemistry, this book can really screw you over. For example, the answer to one practice question talked about a completely irrelevant topic, and another had a blatant mistake that I was fortunate enough to catch. All in all, it seems like not enough editing was done for the 2015 edition of this book, and as a result the book has many discrepancies and blatant errors.
Overall the entire review book is pretty good. However, I've found a couple of mistakes and some topic still remain unclear to me.
They're several typos throughout this book, but it is a good resource and provides thorough explanations for my students.
not too bad for studying, just make sure you have 3 week+ before the AP test if you want to finish the entire thing
Excellent Resource.  Highly recommended.  Very straight forward and understandable!  Great Investment!
Brand new very nice and very fast. I'm happy with my purchase.
Great practice problems and overall good questions and review

I bought this book and compared the practice tests side-by-side with the 2014 book that we have.  They are EXACTLY THE SAME.  This is false marketing and very unfair, especially coming from a company that everyone depends on.  If you already have the 2014 version, don't waste your money.

my friend used the Princeton guide last year to get a 5 and I understand why now! They use detailed explanations and organize everything by the "big ideas" of the quiz. Also, it seems that they've cut out all of the unnecessary​ things.
Item exactly as described. Very useful.
My daughter hates it but I love it.
Good book, recommend it to others.
